title: Coco Gauff
summary: Cori "Coco" Gauff (born March 13, 2004) is an American tennis player. She is the youngest player ranked in the top 100 by the Women's Tennis Association (WTA) and has a career-high ranking of world No. 19 in singles achieved on 13 September 2021 and No. 17 in doubles achieved on 8 November 2021. Gauff won her first WTA singles title at the 2019 Linz Open at age 15, making her the youngest singles title-holder on the WTA Tour since 2004. She won three WTA doubles titles with Caty McNally. Gauff rose to prominence with a win over Venus Williams in the opening round at Wimbledon 2019.
